page.title: 15NEW PONDS IN KNIVETON
page.content: Once there was a pond down Washpool Lane in Kniveton where farmers came to wash their sheep.As the pond became disused, because farmers started to dip their sheep,it began to fill up with silt and became a wild patch of marshy ground. In 1983 two people from the village decided to dig the old pond out to try and make Washpool Lane a more attractive place for people to enjoy. They used a J.C.B. digger to dig out the pond to its old hard bed.They have Surrounded the pond with a wall of stone which they found in the area. It is intended that the pond should have some fish in for the people to watch. Besides the main pond they also dug out a smaller natural pond.This is already full of many interesting creatures.
